extracurriculars.title: Software Engineer Intern
extracurriculars.description: Paid full-stack software engineering position at Ultra (YC24). Building an AI EDUCATION APP that helps ambitious high schoolers reach for the stars :)

extracurriculars.title: Research Intern
extracurriculars.description:
At the UBC Laboratory of Targeted Drug Delivery and Nanomedicine, I have contributed over 300 volunteer hours conducting advanced microscopy analysis for groundbreaking mRNA delivery research. 

My primary responsibilities include:

â€¢ Live-cell imaging analysis to track intracellular particle dynamics and endosomal interactions over extended time periods (45+ minutes)

conversation_history.content: Hi Oliver! If you could fast forward to 2-5 years from now, what long term goal / goals do you have? This could be anything from getting accepted into a dream university, launching your own startup, or becoming a successful practitioner in a field you're passionate about.
I want to get into a top 10 US university, that's my main goal!

Great! I can see you're focused on top 10 university acceptance. Would you like to share some of your extracurricular activities and experiences that relate to these goals? This will help me give you more targeted advice.
Yes, I'd like to share my extracurriculars
Perfect! Please add your extracurricular activities one at a time. For each activity, provide a title and description.

Given your long-term goal of getting accepted into a top 10 university and your impressive involvement in both a software engineering internship and advanced research, let's focus on the "Research project development" milestone. This is critical because top universities highly value significant research experience, especially in cutting-edge fields like AI and nanomedicine.

Have you considered developing an independent research project or seeking opportunities to publish or present your findings
Thanks for sharing! Let's identify some specific next steps to strengthen your profile.

Given your long-term goal of getting accepted into a top 10 university and your impressive involvement in both a software engineering internship and advanced research, let's focus on the "Research project development" milestone. This is critical because top universities highly value significant research experience, especially in cutting-edge fields like AI and nanomedicine.

Have you considered developing an independent research project or seeking opportunities to publish or present your findings
well my boss at the lab that I work at is already trying to get published and im a co-author I also want to learn to write my own research

Since we've already discussed your research project development, let's focus on another critical area that can enhance your profile for top 10 university acceptance: leadership and impact. Taking on leadership roles can significantly strengthen your application by demonstrating initiative and the ability to lead others.

Have you considered pursuing a leadership position, such as an officer role in a club or starting an initiative related to your interests in AI or nanomedicine
yes, I want to start a club related to my niche interested of CS / bio

Given your long-term goal of getting accepted into a top 10 university and your interest in starting a club related to your niche interest in CS and bio, let's focus on the "Leadership position development" milestone. This is crucial as it showcases your ability to lead and innovate, which top universities highly value.

Have you started planning the club you want to start, and do you have a clear vision for
No, I haven't started planning yet. I want to work on my university applications as they are beginning soon.

Counselor: Since we've already discussed your leadership position development, let's focus on another critical area that can enhance your profile for top 10 university acceptance: professional networking exploration. Building industry connections and seeking mentorship can provide valuable insights and opportunities in your fields of interest.

Have you started reaching out to professionals in the AI or nanomedicine fields to build your network or seek mentorship?
